I now think that I have a semi-decent version of my game "The Nebula" which should be ready for people to see. Anybody interested please find it in the link below:

http://textadventures.co.uk/games/view/ ... the-nebula

I am not prepared to release it yet to the wider public, as I think that it needs further review, and I would welcome any comments/ideas/feedback/typos that people would like to point out (please send me private message, post here, or review in the game)

Some points about the game, I have I have been working on it (a gamebook that uses heavy scripting) for around 3 months now. Some of its characteristics so far:

-Character creation system (5 attributes and 6 different skills)
-Combat system (includes the character's dodge, laser attack skill, armour, etc), there are around 11 combat sequences, which are resolved automatically by the game using random number generation.
-322 pages (although some of them sort of change, so I suspect that this underestimates the length of the game).
-Around 17 star systems to explore (though not all are developed to the same extent, still working on adding more things to do in some of them)

The only person to have reviewed the game so far (thank you once more, Jay) has noted already that this is a huge game, and that was at a time when it was half the size it has grown to be. I have done some extensive testing myself, to make sure there are no broken links etc (though if you find any please let me know) and have run a spellchecker (though there are probably still some grammar issues at place/typos). Anyway, all feedback is welcome!

Also, please let me know which parts of the game you enjoyed most/least, so that I can expand the game accordingly
